item.title: Trump's control of D.C. police is limited. Its National Guard is a different story
item.description: President Trump needs Congress' permission to use D.C.'s police for over 30 days, but there are no such limits on its National Guard. Experts spoke to NPR about how the takeover could end.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump needs Congress' permission to use D.C.'s police for over 30 days, but there are no such limits on its National Guard. Experts spoke to NPR about how the takeover could end.

item.title: After the CDC shooting, federal workers pressure RFK Jr. for more protections
item.description: More than 750 current and former HHS employees signed a letter to Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy, Jr. demanding he stop spreading inaccurate information and guarantee the safety of the workforce.

item.title: Nerd! How the word popularized by Dr. Seuss went from geeky insult to mainstream
item.description: Nerd has been part of our lexicon for three-quarters of a century, its geeky meaning embodied by some of the most recognizable characters in film and TV, but its origin story is a bit murky.
